channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road surface failure, 27th December
item.description:
The road surface on the north bound lane of the carriageway has completely failed. This has created a significant danger to any road user as the lane is unusable in its current condition.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cathcart Hill, Archway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No frontline services and discriminatory practice, 27th December
item.description:
I have asked for an investigation into all aspects of Enfield council, with no response. The chief executive is paid around a quarter of a million pounds to hold the council to account - yet does not. I receive no frontline services and I have had to pay vet bills this week and change two tears after broken glass that has been across Winchmore Hill Green for a week, was not swept. There is no street sweeping or ‘cleansing’ across Winchmore Hill . Trees are being felled illegally across church hill. The entire area and wider borough is on a state of lawlessness, filth and unmanaged activity - including illegal parking mr Erbil claims to be tackling - bit not in Winchmore Hill or Ashfield parade - which is another investigation needed into council activity. The chief executive is aware of the absolute failures of this council to maintain decent standards in a borough and be transparent. My dog has cut his feet and two of my tyres need replacing. I am billing the council for these costs. The bins across Grovelands are a health and safety issue and the waste spilling from another week of unemptied bins, into the lake, is clear evidence of the councils disregard for our environment and its wildlife. As Nesil jCaloskan is said to have been overheard at an event, stating that Winchmore Hill needs to see how the other half lives, her and erbil’s council have managed to strategically destroy Winchmore Hill. This I will be addressing through legal recourse. How dare a council not empty our bins or clean our streets at all . The borough is jawless. There is a man living in a tent at the Grovelands park entrance, which is intimidating for women walking alone . The council are aware of this and have condoned it by doing nothing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Church Hill, Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet more dumping of rubbish at this place!, 27th December
item.description:
Christmas Day and yet more bags of rubbish dumped here. Of course, the bags have been opened and there are now clothes and things over the wall and ground. This place is becoming the best dumping place in Barnet. There is stuff dumped here all the time!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Stanhope Road, North Finchley, Greater London

item.title: Potholes, 27th December
item.description:
There are some big forming potholes between 27 and 33 Pickhurst park that either need monitoring or repair. Some of these holes have historically been repaired and have re-opened again. Can we pls for crying out loud, look at a more permanent solution that fits with the current UK climate? Cars in particular use Pickhurst Park as a Silverstone track and are constantly roughing up bad patch and repair works.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Pickhurst Park, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass scattered across entirety of Roper Lane, 27th December
item.description:
A drug addict has taken to throwing glass bottles at people and across the entirety of Roper Lane during the past few days (starting on the 24th Dec and culminating on the 26th) This has left large shards of glass scattered across the road and pavement to the point that it is now impossible for vehicles to pass on the road and the pavements difficult to navigate without having to avoid glass. Would it be possible to have this restored to a safer state? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roper Lane, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Pavement, 27th December
item.description:
There's a bit of broken pavement and uneven surface as a result that requires urgent repair as it's a major trip hazard. In particular, there's an elderly gentleman with a walking aid that walks up and down the hill on a daily basis and I worry he is not going to see the uneven surface on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Pickhurst Park, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
